Module com.example.navalbattle
Package com.example.navalbattle.interfaces

Interface MainTableInterface

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
MainTable
public interface MainTableInterface extends Serializable
Interface representing the machine's game board in the Battleship game. This interface provides methods to interact with the game board, such as placing ships, taking shots, and retrieving board information.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    boolean
    canPlaced(int row, int column, int size, boolean horizontal)
    Checks if a ship of a given size can be placed at the specified position and orientation.
    int[][]
    getBoard()
    Returns the current state of the game board.
    List<int[]>
    getShipCoordinatesList()
    Retrieves the list of ship coordinates.
    int[][]
    getShotGrid()
    Returns the machine's shot grid.
    void
    printMainBoard(int[][] board)
    Prints the game board to the console for debugging purposes.
    void
    setShips()
    Places ships randomly on the board based on the ship sizes defined in the Ships ArrayList.
    int[]
    shot()
    Generates a random shot that has not been previously shot at.
    int[]
    smartShot()
    Generates a smart shot based on the last shot fired.
    void
    startBoard()
    Initializes the game board, setting all cells to 0 (water) and placing the ships.

  • Method Details

    • startBoard

      void startBoard()
      Initializes the game board, setting all cells to 0 (water) and placing the ships.

    • setShips

      void setShips()
      Places ships randomly on the board based on the ship sizes defined in the Ships ArrayList.

    • getBoard

      int[][] getBoard()
      Returns the current state of the game board.
      Returns:
      a 10x10 integer array representing the game board

    • getShipCoordinatesList

      List<int[]> getShipCoordinatesList()
      Retrieves the list of ship coordinates. This list contains the coordinates and related data for each ship, such as position, orientation, and type.
      Returns:
      A list of integer arrays where each array represents the coordinates and other relevant data of a ship.

    • getShotGrid

      int[][] getShotGrid()
      Returns the machine's shot grid. This grid tracks the locations of shots taken.
      Returns:
      a 10x10 integer array representing the shot grid

    • shot

      int[] shot()
      Generates a random shot that has not been previously shot at.
      Returns:
      an array of two integers representing the (x, y) coordinates of the shot.

    • smartShot

      int[] smartShot()
      Generates a smart shot based on the last shot fired.
      Returns:
      an array of two integers representing the (x, y) coordinates of the smart shot.

    • canPlaced

      boolean canPlaced(int row, int column, int size, boolean horizontal)
      Checks if a ship of a given size can be placed at the specified position and orientation.
      Parameters:
      row - the starting row for the ship
      column - the starting column for the ship
      size - the size of the ship
      horizontal - the orientation of the ship (true for horizontal, false for vertical)
      Returns:
      true if the ship can be placed at the specified position, false otherwise

    • printMainBoard

      void printMainBoard(int[][] board)
      Prints the game board to the console for debugging purposes.
      Parameters:
      board - the board to print
